result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:29 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Joshua M Otto appeared by Zoom, in custody at the Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Joshua M Otto. 

Attorney Galaviz requests to toll the time limits to see how his other case proceeds.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
The Court will adjourn.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM MILWAUKEE HOUSE OF CORRECTIONS AT THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Detainer placed at: Milwaukee House of Corrections

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Defendant to have no contact with Karla Wallace listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant is not to discuss the case with Paula Otto.

2:50 PM Defendant Joshua M Otto appeared by zoom video, in custody Milwaukee House of Corrections. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marufo. Attorney Steve Hughes appears as friend of the court. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
Defendant has a plea and sentencing date on 10/14/2022 for his Milwaukee County cases.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:30 AM Defendant Joshua M Otto not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
